de.feig.FEDM.Core

Class IBrmTableGroup

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.feig.FEDM.Core.IBrmTableGroup

  • public class IBrmTableGroup
extends java.lang.Object
    Internal class providing Buffered Read Mode table specific methods.
    Description:
    This class realizes the nested interface with special methods for Buffered Read Mode table for the Reader class ReaderModule.
    Methods of this class can be called with the IBrmTable member of ReaderModule.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  IBrmTableGroup.BrmTableItem
      Class represents one record of requested Buffered Read Mode data with command [0x22] Read Buffer or with received Notification data.
      class  IBrmTableGroup.BufferInfo

    • Method Detail

      • setSize

        public int setSize(int newSize)
            throws FeException
        Set size of the table
        Parameters:
        newSize - Maximal numbers of records in the Buffered Read Mode Table
        Returns:
        if successful (=0) or error code (<0)
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        The call of this method or overloaded setSize(int,int,int) is mandatory, when the Buffered Read Mode Table should be used in the application.
        The table size should be set to the maximal number of records, received by the command [0x22] Read Buffer or with Notification data.
        This method initializes the buffer for Transponder data to 1024 bytes, which means 256 data blocks of each 4 bytes. The content of the table will be deleted.

      • setSize

        public int setSize(int newSize,
                   int newRxDB_BlockCount,
                   int newRxDB_BlockSize)
            throws FeException
        Set size of the table with additional option to set the Transponder data buffer size
        Parameters:
        newSize - Maximal numbers of records in the Buffered Read Mode Table
        newRxDB_BlockCount - Number of data blocks
        newRxDB_BlockSize - Size of each data block in byte
        Returns:
        if successful (>0) or error code (<0)
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        The call of this method or overloaded setSize(int) is mandatory, when the Buffered Read Mode Table should be used in the application.
        The table size should be set to the maximal number of records, received by the command [0x22] Read Buffer or with Notification data.
        This method initializes the buffer for Transponder data to user defined size, calculated by newRxDB_BlockCount data blocks with each newRxDB_BlockSize bytes.
        The content of the table will be deleted.

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
            throws FeException
        Return actual table size
        Returns:
        Size (>0) or error code (<0)
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

      • readBuffer

        public int readBuffer(int dataSets)
               throws FeException
        Read data sets from Reader's internal data buffer with [0x22] Read Buffer command.
        Parameters:
        dataSets - Number of requested data sets. Must be less than 256.
        If the data buffer does not contain the requested number of data sets, the Reader responds with all available data sets.
        Returns:
        0: OK
        >0: status byte of the responded protocol, if the Reader signals a problem. See Reader's System Manual for the full list with all status bytes
        It is strongly recommended to evaluate always the return value in the application.

        Description:
        This command is only applicable when the Buffered Read Mode is enabled in the Reader.
        The responded data records are stored in the internal BrmTable. Each record can be successively requested as a BrmTableItem with the method GetItemByIndex.
        The Buffered Read Mode is widely configurable and the settings determine the responded data. For more information about the configuration, see Reader's System Manual.
        The configuration parameters for the Buffered Read Mode are collected in the parameter namespace ReaderConfig.OperatingMode.BufferedReadMode.
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

      • clearBuffer

        public int clearBuffer()
                throws FeException
        Clear of transferred data sets from Reader's internal data buffer with [0x32] Clear Data Buffer command.
        Returns:
        0: OK
        >0: status byte of the responded protocol, if the Reader signals a problem. See Reader's System Manual for the full list with all status bytes
        It is strongly recommended to evaluate always the return value in the application.

        Description:
        The clear command deletes all already transferred data sets in the Reader's internal data buffer.
        All not queried data sets remain in the buffer until they are queried with readBuffer.
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

      • initializeBuffer

        public int initializeBuffer()
                     throws FeException
        Initialize of the Reader's internal data buffer with [0x33] Initialize Buffer command.
        Returns:
        0: OK
        >0: status byte of the responded protocol, if the Reader signals a problem. See Reader's System Manual for the full list with all status bytes
        It is strongly recommended to evaluate always the return value in the application.

        Description:
        The internal buffer is cleared and all data gets lost.
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

      • getBufferInfo

        public IBrmTableGroup.BufferInfo getBufferInfo()
                                        throws FeException
        Query of current fill level and size of the Reader's internal data buffer with [0x31] Read Data Buffer Info command.
        Returns:
        BufferInfo object

        Description:
        The Reader's internal data buffer is organized as a First-in First-out memory (FIFO) with the size of tableSize.
        If the buffer is full (tableLength == tableSize), every new generated data set overwrites the oldest data set.
        An overflow is indicated with the return status 0x93 (Data Buffer Overflow) of method readBuffer.
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

      • getLength

        public int getLength()
              throws FeException
        Get number of valid table items
        Returns:
        Length of table
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        Call this method to get the actual number of valid table items after the command [0x22] Read Buffer or after receiving Notification data.

      • getItemByIndex

        public IBrmTableGroup.BrmTableItem getItemByIndex(int index)
                                           throws FeException
        Get a valid table item, identified by index
        Parameters:
        index - Table index, beginning with 0
        Returns:
        table item. See BrmTableItem for more information
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        With this method, the table items (each contains one record from the Reader response) can be gradually requested.

        Example:
         
  NOTE: reader is an object of type de.feig.FEDM.Core.ReaderModule

  import de.feig.FEDM.Core.*;
  import de.feig.FEDM.Core.IBrmTableGroup.*;

  BrmTableItem item = null; // one table item

  reader.ICmd.setCommandPara(ReaderCommand._0x22.Req.DATA_SETS, (int)255);
  int back = reader.ICmd.sendProtocol((byte)0x22);
  if( back == 0 ||              // status: OK
      back == 0x84 ||           // status: RF warning
      back == 0x93 ||           // status: buffer overflow
      back == 0x94 )            // status: more data
  {
      // internal Buffered Read Mode Table contains now the new records

      for(int iIdx=0; iIdx<reader.IBrmTable.getLength(); iIdx++)
      {
          item = reader.IBrmTable.getItemByIndex(iIdx);
          if(item.isSnr == true)
          {
              // IDD is part of the received record
          }

          if(item.isDB == true)
          {
              // received record contains Transponder data
          }
      }
  }
